Package neuralnet

Class NeuronNetwork

java.lang.Object
neuralnet.NeuronNetwork
public class NeuronNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
this class create standard neural network, less efficient that the NeuralNetwork class but allow more complex structure this is inspired by the Neat AI algorithm
Version:
1.1
Author:
PhysicDev

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Neuron>> Layers
    Do not modify this variable.
    float learningRate
    learning rate is the amount of modification made by one backPropagation cycle, larger value mean faster result but less precision.
    float weightDistrib
    this variable is used for the weight randomization, larger value mean mor espread out value

    NeuronNetwork clone()
    return an Independent copy of the network I don't know why but the clone function is very sensible to bug, if there are one bug in the neuron network, there are a high chance it will trigger an error in this
    float compare​(NeuronNetwork NN)
    compare the structure and the weight of two Neuron Network, 0 mean the networks are exactly the same, greater value mean the networks are more different
    int Complexity()  
    void compute()
    compute the output of the Neural network with the data already loaded in the inputs neurons
    void compute​(float[] data)
    compute the output of the Neural network
    void disableConnection​(neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Synapse S)
    disable the Synapse S
    void enableConnection​(neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Synapse S)
    enable the Synapse S
    float getFitness()
    the fitness indicate how well the neuron is working used in genetic algorithm but can also be used to track the learning of the neural netowrk

    higher value mean better result.
    int getInputLength()
    return the number of input of the neural network
    int getOutputLength()
    return the number of output of the neural network
    float[] getOutputs()
    give the outputs in a float array
    int getSize()  
    java.lang.String Header()
    return a simple representation of the Neural network
    boolean isEmpty()
    check if the network contain at least one neuron
    boolean isSimple()
    check if the neuron network has at least one connection this is different from the method is empty because a network with input and output is not empty but can be simple.
    NeuronNetwork merge​(NeuronNetwork NN)
    create a copy of the network and take randomly the weight of the second network if the synapse are the same
    void mutate()
    do some random little modification to the neural network to get random new behavior without losing the old ones.
    void mutateConnection​(float probNew, float probDel, float probAct, int attempt)
    will try to add, remove, or activate connection
    void mutateNode​(float probNew, float probMerge)
    mutate the network by adding a node in a synapse (the new neuron become the children of the inner neuron and the parent of the outetr neuron) or by removing a random neuron.
    void mutateWeight​(float prob, float resetProb, float amount)
    mutate weight, take some weight and change a little bit the value of the neuron.
    void normalizeNetwork()
    delete useless neuron and collapse the network in it minimal structure (by taking the minimum amount of layer) useful to compare two similar network that were build differently.
    void reasignId()
    Reassign Neuron and Synapse Id using this method with the normalize method make two network with the same topology almost exactly equal
    void removeConnection​(int[] parentCoord, int[] childrenCoord)
    remove a connection between two neuron
    void removeConnection​(int ParentId, int ChildrenId)
    remove a connection between two neuron
    void removeConnection​(neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Neuron Parent, neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Neuron Children)
    remove the connection between two Neuron
    void removeNode​(int Id)
    remove the Neuron with the corresponding Id
    void resetFitness()
    reset the fitness value, useful to get rid of old test to see the current state of the network
    void setActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> actf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> derf)
    define the activation function used by the neural network Warning !
    void setActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> actf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> derf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> outActf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> outDerf)
    define the activations functions used by the neural network:

    all of the layer will use the first activation function except the output layer which will use the second one Warning !
    void setActivation​(utilities.functions f)
    do the same thing as setActivation(Function, Function) but with the built-in activation function Warning !
    void setActivation​(utilities.functions f, utilities.functions outf)
    do the same thing as setActivation(Function, Function,Function,Function) but with the built-in activation function Warning !
    void setInputs​(float[] data)
    assign inputs to Inputs Neurons
    void SetRandom​(java.util.Random rand)
    if you want to control the randomness of the network (for the weight randomization for example)
    java.lang.String toString()
    return a complete representation of the Neural network

    test the neural network and add the result to the fitness value

    • weightDistrib

      public float weightDistrib
      this variable is used for the weight randomization, larger value mean mor espread out value
      Since:
      1.0

    • learningRate

      public float learningRate
      learning rate is the amount of modification made by one backPropagation cycle, larger value mean faster result but less precision.
      Since:
      1.0

    • Layers

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<neuralnet.NeuronNetwork.Neuron>> Layers
      Do not modify this variable. it's public only to make computation easier

  • Constructor Details

    • NeuronNetwork

      public NeuronNetwork() throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      build an empty neural Network
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Since:
      1.1

    • NeuronNetwork

      public NeuronNetwork​(int In, int[] Hid, int Out, float Integrity) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Create a New Neuron network based on a fully connected network Structure. the Integrity value control the amount of connection that will be create, 0 mean no connection 1 mean all the connection (same as fully connected)
      Parameters:
      In - number of Input neurons
      Hid - number of hidden neurons by layer
      Out - number of output neurons
      Integrity - amount of connection created
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the structure data is null or negative
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      NeuronNetwork(int[]), NeuronNetwork(int[],float), NeuronNetwork(int, int[], int)

    • NeuronNetwork

      public NeuronNetwork​(int[] structure, float Integrity)
      Create a New Neuron network based on a fully connected network Structure. the Integrity value control the amount of connection that will be create, 0 mean no connection 1 mean all the connection (same as fully connected)
      Parameters:
      structure - the amount of neurons by layer
      Integrity - amount of connection created
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the structure data is null or negative
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      NeuronNetwork(int, int[], int, float), NeuronNetwork(int[]), NeuronNetwork(int, int[], int)

    • setActivation

      public void setActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> actf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> derf)
      define the activation function used by the neural network Warning ! the softMax function not working on this neural network
      Parameters:
      actf - the activation function
      derf - the derivative of the activation function
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActivation(functions), setActivation(functions, functions), setActivation(Function, Function, Function, Function)

    • setActivation

      public void setActivation​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> actf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> derf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> outActf, java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Float,​java.lang.Float> outDerf)
      define the activations functions used by the neural network:

      all of the layer will use the first activation function except the output layer which will use the second one Warning ! the softMax function not working on this neural network
      Parameters:
      actf - the first activation function
      derf - the derivative of the first activation function
      outActf - the second activation function
      outDerf - the derivative of the second activation function
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActivation(functions), setActivation(functions, functions), setActivation(Function, Function)

    • setActivation

      public void setActivation​(utilities.functions f)
      do the same thing as setActivation(Function, Function) but with the built-in activation function Warning ! the softMax function not working on this neural network
      Parameters:
      f - the activations functions
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActivation(Function, Function)

    • setActivation

      public void setActivation​(utilities.functions f, utilities.functions outf)
      do the same thing as setActivation(Function, Function,Function,Function) but with the built-in activation function Warning ! the softMax function not working on this neural network
      Parameters:
      f - the activations functions
      outf - the output activation function
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      setActivation(Function, Function,Function,Function)

    • getFitness

      public float getFitness()
      the fitness indicate how well the neuron is working used in genetic algorithm but can also be used to track the learning of the neural netowrk

      higher value mean better result.
      Returns:
      the fitness of the neural network
      Since:
      1.0

      Returns:

    • isSimple

      public boolean isSimple()
      check if the neuron network has at least one connection this is different from the method is empty because a network with input and output is not empty but can be simple.
      Returns:
      true if the neuron has 0 synapses
      Since:
      1.1

    • mutate

      public void mutate()
      do some random little modification to the neural network to get random new behavior without losing the old ones. this method will call mutateWeight, mutateNode and mutateConnection with the following parameter :
      • Weights : 0.8 0.1 WeightDistrib*0.2
      • Connections : 0.05 0.05 0.25 20
      • Nodes : 0.1 0.1
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      mutateWeight(float, float, float), mutateConnection(float, float, float, int), mutateNode(float, float)

    • mutateNode

      public void mutateNode​(float probNew, float probMerge) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      mutate the network by adding a node in a synapse (the new neuron become the children of the inner neuron and the parent of the outetr neuron) or by removing a random neuron.
      note that bias, output and input neuron cannot be removed or created.
      Parameters:
      probNew - probability of new neuron
      probMerge - probability of removing a neuron
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Since:
      1.1
      See Also:
      mutate()

    • mutateConnection

      public void mutateConnection​(float probNew, float probDel, float probAct, int attempt) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      will try to add, remove, or activate connection
      Parameters:
      probNew - probability of new connection
      probDel - probability of removing connection
      probAct - probability of activating a connection
      attempt - how many time it will try to create a connection
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • mutateWeight

      public void mutateWeight​(float prob, float resetProb, float amount) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      mutate weight, take some weight and change a little bit the value of the neuron. it can also reset a connection (take a random value for its weights.
      Parameters:
      prob - probability of changing a weight value
      resetProb - probability that the change will reset the value (the probability of a connection reset is prob*resetProb)
      amount - how much is weight changed.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Parameters:
      data - the input data array
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data array's size does not match the number of inputs

      1.0

    • backPropagation

      public void backPropagation​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      train the Neural network using the database
      Parameters:
      data - the data array
      target - the wanted output for the data array
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data and target array does not have the same size or one of the data size does not match the inputs/outputs size
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      backPropagation(ArrayList, ArrayList, int), backPropagation(float[], float[])

    • backPropagation

      public void backPropagation​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target, int tests) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      train the Neural network using the database
      Parameters:
      data - the data array
      target - the wanted output for the data array
      tests - the number of test cycle (one test cycle is the size of the database)
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data and target array does not have the same size or one of the data size does not match the inputs/outputs size
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      backPropagation(ArrayList, ArrayList), backPropagation(float[], float[])

    • backPropagation

      public void backPropagation​(float[] data, float[] target) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      update the weight to give outputs closer to the target next time
      Parameters:
      data - the inputs values
      target - the target values
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data or target array size does not match the inputs and outputs size
      Since:
      1.0
      See Also:
      backPropagation(ArrayList, ArrayList), backPropagation(ArrayList, ArrayList, int)

    • train

      public void train​(float[] data, float[] target) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      test the neural network and add the result to the fitness value
      Parameters:
      data - the test inputs
      target - the wanted outputs
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data or target array size does not match the inputs and outputs size
      Since:
      1.0

    • train

      public void train​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      test the neural network and add the result to the fitness value
      Parameters:
      data - the test ArrayList
      target - the wanted outputs ArrayList
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the data or target array size does not match the inputs and outputs size or the size of the data and target arraylist are not the same
      Since:
      1.0

    • normalizeNetwork

      public void normalizeNetwork()
      delete useless neuron and collapse the network in it minimal structure (by taking the minimum amount of layer) useful to compare two similar network that were build differently.
      Since:
      1.0

    • reasignId

      public void reasignId()
      Reassign Neuron and Synapse Id using this method with the normalize method make two network with the same topology almost exactly equal
      Since:
      1.1

    • compare

      public float compare​(NeuronNetwork NN)
      compare the structure and the weight of two Neuron Network, 0 mean the networks are exactly the same, greater value mean the networks are more different
      Returns:
      the comparison value
      Since:
      1.0

    • Header

      public java.lang.String Header()
      return a simple representation of the Neural network
      Returns:
